Sorry we dropped the ball on the Gladiator: Beyond Freedom project.
Basically, we were moving forward with it, but then most of our original
group went and got jobs (like Blizzard) where pretty much every spare moment
of our time was taken up with work-related games, rather than our original
FSGames-related stuff :( So the code for that has pretty much sat, rarely
touched, for a while now :(
 
On a side note -- I've seen W3 listed for something like $39.00 in our local
San Jose Mercury paper.  I don't actually know how legitimate that is, but
assuming it's not just a pirated copy, that'd mean the regular (not Special
Edition, though) cost has started to come down.  Of course, I guess I should
be hoping you'll all buy a copy for a few hundred dollars and make me rich
;-)
 
--Tom

-----Original Message-----
From: bluedrgnkid@... [mailto:bluedrgnkid@...]
Sent: Monday, July 22, 2002 10:16 PM
To: gladiator@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [gladiator] Gladiator, beyond freedom


Sorry for the blank mail, it was a accident. 
Is anyone going to finish that? I was thinking Tom would because of his new 
WC3 style tricks ( I'm gonna pick WC3 up once the price goes under 49 
dollars) And i've always liked Gladiator. It's like ---(insert star or 
war)Craft minus the crappy controls.
